Comment: >"In the event that Defendants do not choose to purge their contempt, the Court will proceed to identify the individual(s) responsible for the contumacious conduct by determining whose 'specific act or omission' caused the noncompliance," he wrote, and that person or those people would be prosecuted.  In any other decade, that would be startling.  Judge is ready to put Trump cabinet in jail for criminal contempt.  What a message that would send, right?  Wrong.  SCOTUS gave Trump immunity, and Trump will pardon any crime of anyone in the exec branch.  SCOTUS wants to put the responsibility on congress to impeach.  But congress is just as sold out to the rich as SCOTUS is.  And SCOTUS chose to twist US Constitution into a pretzel in order to rule that our POTUS is a king above the law.  We need a mass impeachment event if we are ever going to get back to being a democracy again.  We need majority Dem house, and 2/3 Dem senate, and I'm not talking about the kind of Dem who has been voting with the maggots lately.
Author: Tiny_Structure_7
